        # "strict": True
    },
]

# =========================
# 3) Chat Completions ìª½ í•¨ìˆ˜ í˜¸ì¶œ ë£¨í”„
# =========================

def run_chat_completions(cfg: ModelConfig, user_task: str, tools_variant: str) -> str:
    """
    tools_variant: "chat" ë˜ëŠ” "responses"
    "chat"  -> CHAT_STYLE_TOOLS ì‚¬ìš© (ê¶Œì¥)
    "responses" -> RESPONSES_STYLE_TOOLS ì‚¬ìš© (ì˜ë„ì  ë¹„í˜¸í™˜ ê°€ëŠ¥)
    """
    client = OpenAI(base_url=cfg.base_url, api_key=cfg.api_key)
    tools = CHAT_STYLE_TOOLS if tools_variant == "chat" else RESPONSES_STYLE_TOOLS

    messages = [
        {"role": "system", "content": "You are a helpful assistant that uses tools when needed."},
        {"role": "user", "content": user_task},
    ]
    resp = client.chat.completions.create(
        model=cfg.name,
        messages=messages,
        tools=tools,
        tool_choice="auto",
    )
    msg = resp.choices[0].message

    # tool_calls ë£¨í”„
    guard = 0
    while getattr(msg, "tool_calls", None) and guard < 8:
        guard += 1
        tool_msgs = []
        for call in msg.tool_calls:
            fn_name = call.function.name
            # argumentsëŠ” ë¬¸ìì—´ì¼ ìˆ˜ ìˆìŒ
            try:
                fn_args = json.loads(call.function.arguments or "{}")
            except Exception:
                fn_args = {}
            tool_output = dispatch_tool(fn_name, fn_args)

            tool_msgs.append({
                "role": "tool",
                "tool_call_id": call.id,
                "name": fn_name,
                "content": json.dumps(tool_output, ensure_ascii=False),
            })

        # ëŒ€í™” ì´ì–´ë¶™ì´ê¸°
        messages.append({
            "role": "assistant",
            "content": msg.content or "",
            "tool_calls": [tc.model_dump() for tc in msg.tool_calls],
        })
        messages.extend(tool_msgs)

        resp = client.chat.completions.create(model=cfg.name, messages=messages)
        msg = resp.choices[0].message

    return msg.content or ""

# =========================
# 4) Responses ìª½ í•¨ìˆ˜ í˜¸ì¶œ ë£¨í”„
# =========================

def _collect_function_calls_from_output(output: List[Any]) -> List[Dict[str, Any]]:
    """
    Responses APIì˜ output ë°°ì—´ì—ì„œ function_call / tool_call ë¥˜ ì´ë²¤íŠ¸ë¥¼ ì¶”ì¶œ.
    ë‹¤ì–‘í•œ ì¼€ì´ìŠ¤ë¥¼ ìµœëŒ€í•œ ê´€ëŒ€í•˜ê²Œ ì²˜ë¦¬í•œë‹¤.
    """
    calls: List[Dict[str, Any]] = []
    for item in output or []:
        itype = getattr(item, "type", None)

        # ì¼€ì´ìŠ¤ A: item.type == "function_call"
        if itype == "function_call":
            name = getattr(item, "name", None)
            args = getattr(item, "arguments", {})
            if isinstance(args, str):
                try:
                    args = json.loads(args)
                except Exception:
                    args = {}
            calls.append({
                "call_id": getattr(item, "call_id", None),
                "name": name,
                "arguments": args or {},
            })

        # ì¼€ì´ìŠ¤ B: ì¼ë¶€ ëª¨ë¸ì´ "tool_call" / item.message.tool_calls í˜•íƒœë¡œ ì¤„ ë•Œ
        if itype == "message":
            inner = getattr(item, "tool_calls", None)
            if inner:
                for c in inner:
                    nm = getattr(getattr(c, "function", {}), "name", None) if hasattr(c, "function") else getattr(c, "name", None)
                    args = getattr(getattr(c, "function", {}), "arguments", {})
                    if isinstance(args, str):
                        try:
                            args = json.loads(args)
                        except Exception:
                            args = {}
                    calls.append({
                        "call_id": getattr(c, "id", None),
                        "name": nm,
                        "arguments": args or {},
                    })
    return calls

def _collect_text_from_output(output: List[Any]) -> str:
    texts: List[str] = []
    for item in output or []:
        if getattr(item, "type", "") == "message":
            for c in getattr(item, "content", []) or []:
                if getattr(c, "type", "") == "output_text":
                    texts.append(getattr(c, "text", ""))
        if getattr(item, "type", "") == "output_text":
            texts.append(getattr(item, "text", ""))
    return "\n".join([t for t in texts if t])

def run_responses(cfg: ModelConfig, user_task: str, tools_variant: str) -> str:
    """
    tools_variant: "chat" ë˜ëŠ” "responses"
    "responses" -> RESPONSES_STYLE_TOOLS ì‚¬ìš© (ê¶Œì¥)
    "chat"      -> CHAT_STYLE_TOOLS ì‚¬ìš© (ì˜ë„ì  ë¹„í˜¸í™˜ ê°€ëŠ¥)
    ìˆœìˆ˜ Responses ë°©ì‹: ë„¤ê°€ ì¤€ ì˜ˆì‹œ íŒ¨í„´(input_list ì¶•ì  + function_call_output)ë¡œ êµ¬í˜„.
    """
    client = OpenAI(base_url=cfg.base_url, api_key=cfg.api_key)
    tools = RESPONSES_STYLE_TOOLS if tools_variant == "responses" else CHAT_STYLE_TOOLS

    # running input_list
    input_list: List[Dict[str, Any]] = [
        {"role": "user", "content": user_task}
    ]

    r = client.responses.create(
        model=cfg.name,
        tools=tools,
        input=input_list,
    )

    # function_call ì²˜ë¦¬
    input_list += list(getattr(r, "output", []) or [])

    # callë“¤ì„ ì°¾ì•„ ì‹¤í–‰í•˜ê³ , function_call_outputì„ ì´ì–´ ë¶™ì„
    calls = _collect_function_calls_from_output(getattr(r, "output", []))
    for call in calls:
        result = dispatch_tool(call["name"], call["arguments"])
        input_list.append({
            "type": "function_call_output",
            "call_id": call["call_id"],
            "output": json.dumps(result, ensure_ascii=False),
        })

    # ìµœì¢… ì‘ë‹µ ì‹œë„(ì§€ì‹œë¬¸ì„ ì¶”ê°€ì ìœ¼ë¡œ ì¤„ ìˆ˜ë„ ìˆìŒ)
    r2 = client.responses.create(
        model=cfg.name,
        instructions="Respond with a short summary of what you found.",
        tools=tools,
        input=input_list,
    )

    # í…ìŠ¤íŠ¸ ì¶”ì¶œ(ì¤‘ê°„/ìµœì¢…)
    final_text = []
    txt1 = _collect_text_from_output(getattr(r, "output", []))
    if txt1: final_text.append(txt1)
    txt2 = _collect_text_from_output(getattr(r2, "output", []))
    if txt2: final_text.append(txt2)
    return "\n".join([t for t in final_text if t]) or ""

# =========================
# 5) 8ê°œ ì¡°í•© ì‹¤í–‰ê¸°
# =========================

DEFAULT_TASK = (
    "í…ŒìŠ¤íŠ¸: ./samples í´ë”ì˜ íŒŒì¼ ëª©ë¡ì„ ë³´ì—¬ì£¼ê³ , í…ìŠ¤íŠ¸ íŒŒì¼ì´ ìˆìœ¼ë©´ í•˜ë‚˜ ê³¨ë¼ ë‚´ìš©ì„ ì½ê³  2~3ë¬¸ì¥ ìš”ì•½. í•„ìš”í•˜ë©´ ë„êµ¬ë¥¼ ì‚¬ìš©í•´."
)

def run_one(api_type: str, model_key: str, tools_variant: str, user_task: str) -> None:
    cfg = MODELS[model_key]
    header = f"[{api_type.upper()}] model={model_key}:{cfg.name} tools_json={tools_variant}"
    print("\n" + "=" * (len(header) + 2))
    print(f" {header} ")
    print("=" * (len(header) + 2))

    try:
        if api_type == "completions":
            out = run_chat_completions(cfg, user_task, tools_variant)
        elif api_type == "responses":
            out = run_responses(cfg, user_task, tools_variant)
        else:
            raise ValueError("api_type must be 'completions' or 'responses'")
        print("\n--- OUTPUT ---")
        print(out or "(empty)")
    except Exception as e:
        print("\n--- ERROR ---")
        print(repr(e))

def main():
    parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(description="Run 8 combinations: 2 models Ã— 2 APIs Ã— 2 tools JSON styles.")
    parser.add_argument("--task", default=DEFAULT_TASK)
    parser.add_argument("--models", choices=["A", "B", "both"], default="both")
    parser.add_argument("--apis", choices=["completions", "responses", "both"], default="both")
    # tools_variantë¥¼ "both"ë¡œ ë‘ë©´ ê° APIì—ì„œ chat/â€‹responses ë‘ ê°€ì§€ íˆ´ JSON ëª¨ë‘ ì‹œë„ â†’ 8ì¡°í•©
    parser.add_argument("--tools", choices=["chat", "responses", "both"], default="both")
    args = parser.parse_args()

    # ìƒ˜í”Œ í´ë” ìƒì„± ì•ˆë‚´
    os.makedirs("./samples", exist_ok=True)

    model_keys = ["A", "B"] if args.models == "both" else [args.models]
    api_types = ["completions", "responses"] if args.apis == "both" else [args.apis]
    tool_variants = ["chat", "responses"] if args.tools == "both" else [args.tools]

    # 8ì¡°í•©: 2ëª¨ë¸ Ã— 2API Ã— 2JSON
    for mk in model_keys:
        for api in api_types:
            for tv in tool_variants:
                run_one(api, mk, tv, args.task)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()

def list_directory(path: str) -> Dict[str, Any]:
    p = Path(path).expanduser().resolve()
    if not p.exists() or not p.is_dir():
        return {"ok": False, "error": f"Directory not found: {p}"}

    items = []
    for child in sorted(p.iterdir()):
        try:
            items.append({
                "name": child.name,
                "is_dir": child.is_dir(),
                "size": None if child.is_dir() else child.stat().st_size
            })
        except Exception as e:
            items.append({"name": child.name, "error": str(e)})
    return {"ok": True, "path": str(p), "items": items}

def read_file(path: str, max_bytes: int = 200_000) -> Dict[str, Any]:
    p = Path(path).expanduser().resolve()
    if not p.exists() or not p.is_file():
        return {"ok": False, "error": f"File not found: {p}"}

    try:
        # í…ìŠ¤íŠ¸ íŒŒì¼ ê°€ì •. ì´ì§„ íŒŒì¼ì´ë©´ ê¹¨ì§ˆ ìˆ˜ ìˆìŒ â†’ errors='replace'
        data = p.read_text(encoding="utf-8", errors="replace")
        if len(data) > max_bytes:
            data = data[:max_bytes] + "\n... [truncated]"
        return {"ok": True, "path": str(p), "content": data}
    except Exception as e:
        return {"ok": False, "error": str(e)}

def extract_function_calls(response_obj: Any) -> List[Dict[str, Any]]:
    """
    Responses APIì˜ ì‘ë‹µì—ì„œ function_call í•­ëª©ì„ ì¶”ì¶œ.
    SDK ë²„ì „ë§ˆë‹¤ íƒ€ì… í´ë˜ìŠ¤ê°€ ë‹¬ë¼ì§ˆ ìˆ˜ ìˆìœ¼ë¯€ë¡œ dictë¡œ ì•ˆì „í•˜ê²Œ ì²˜ë¦¬.
    ê° í•­ëª©: { "call_id": str, "name": str, "arguments": dict }
    """
    data = response_obj.model_dump() if hasattr(response_obj, "model_dump") else response_obj
    calls = []
    for item in data.get("output", []):
        if item.get("type") == "function_call":
            name = item.get("name")
            call_id = item.get("call_id")
            # argumentsëŠ” dict ì´ê±°ë‚˜ JSON stringì¼ ìˆ˜ ìˆìŒ
            raw_args = item.get("arguments", {})
            if isinstance(raw_args, str):
                try:
                    raw_args = json.loads(raw_args)
                except Exception:
                    raw_args = {}
            calls.append({"call_id": call_id, "name": name, "arguments": raw_args})
    return calls

def run_tool_call(name: str, arguments: Dict[str, Any]) -> str:
    """
    í•´ë‹¹ íˆ´ì„ ì‹¤ì œ ì‹¤í–‰í•˜ê³ , ë¬¸ìì—´(JSON)ë¡œ ê²°ê³¼ë¥¼ ë°˜í™˜.
    ëª¨ë¸ë¡œ ëŒë ¤ë³´ë‚¼ ë•ŒëŠ” ë¬¸ìì—´ì´ì–´ì•¼ í•©ë‹ˆë‹¤.
    """
    fn = FUNCTIONS.get(name)
    if not fn:
        return json.dumps({"ok": False, "error": f"Unknown function: {name}"})
    try:
        result = fn(**arguments)
        return json.dumps(result, ensure_ascii=False)
    except TypeError as e:
        # ì˜ëª»ëœ ì¸ì ë“±
        return json.dumps({"ok": False, "error": f"Bad arguments for {name}: {e}"}, ensure_ascii=False)
    except Exception as e:
        return json.dumps({"ok": False, "error": str(e)}, ensure_ascii=False)

    3) ë” ì´ìƒ íˆ´ í˜¸ì¶œì´ ì—†ì„ ë•Œ ìµœì¢… í…ìŠ¤íŠ¸ë¥¼ ë°˜í™˜
    """
    prev_id = None

    while True:

            resp = client.responses.create(

            resp = client.responses.create(

        tool_outputs = []

        prev_id = resp.id  # ì´ì–´ì§€ëŠ” í„´ì—ì„œ previous_response_idë¡œ ì—°ê²°

    return final_text or ""

class Conversation:
    def __init__(self, client: OpenAI, model: str, tools: List[Dict[str, Any]]):
        self.client = client
        self.model = model
        self.tools = tools
        self.last_response_id = None  # ë§ˆì§€ë§‰ assistant ì‘ë‹µì˜ id

    def run_turn(self, user_input: str) -> str:
        """
        í•œ í„´ì„ ìˆ˜í–‰:
          1) ì‚¬ìš©ì ì…ë ¥ì„ ëª¨ë¸ì— ë³´ëƒ„(ë¬¸ë§¥ ì—°ê²°: previous_response_id ì‚¬ìš©)
          2) function_callì´ ìˆìœ¼ë©´ ì‹¤ì œ ì‹¤í–‰ â†’ tool_outputsë¡œ ì¬í˜¸ì¶œ
          3) function_callì´ ë” ì´ìƒ ì—†ìœ¼ë©´ ìµœì¢… í…ìŠ¤íŠ¸ ë°˜í™˜
        """
        # 1) ì‚¬ìš©ì ì…ë ¥ ì „ì†¡
        if self.last_response_id is None:
            resp = self.client.responses.create(
                model=self.model,
                tools=self.tools,
                input=user_input
            )
        else:
            resp = self.client.responses.create(
                model=self.model,
                tools=self.tools,
                previous_response_id=self.last_response_id,
                input=user_input
            )

        # 2) íˆ´ í˜¸ì¶œ ë£¨í”„
        while True:
            calls = extract_function_calls(resp)
            if not calls:
                break

            tool_outputs = []
            for call in calls:
                result = run_tool_call(call["name"], call["arguments"])
                tool_outputs.append({
                    "tool_call_id": call["call_id"],
                    "output": result
                })

            resp = self.client.responses.create(
                model=self.model,
                tools=self.tools,
                previous_response_id=resp.id,
                tool_outputs=tool_outputs
            )

        # 3) ìµœì¢… í…ìŠ¤íŠ¸ì™€ ì‘ë‹µ id ê°±ì‹ 
        text = get_output_text(resp)
        self.last_response_id = resp.id
        return text

class SimpleMcpClient:
    """
    MCP í´ë¼ì´ì–¸íŠ¸ë¥¼ ê°„ë‹¨ ë˜í•‘. SDKì˜ ì‹¤ì œ ì¸í„°í˜ì´ìŠ¤ì— ë§ê²Œ ì¡°ì •í•˜ì„¸ìš”.
    """

    def __init__(
        self,
        stdio_cmd: Optional[List[str]] = None,
        stdio_env: Optional[Dict[str, str]] = None,
        http_url: Optional[str] = None,
        http_headers: Optional[Dict[str, str]] = None,
    ) -> None:
        if stdio_cmd:
            self.transport = StdioTransport(command=stdio_cmd, env=stdio_env or {})
        elif http_url and HttpClientTransport:
            self.transport = HttpClientTransport(url=http_url, headers=http_headers or {})
        else:
            raise ValueError("stdio_cmd ë˜ëŠ” http_url ì¤‘ í•˜ë‚˜ëŠ” í•„ìš”í•©ë‹ˆë‹¤.")
        self.session: Optional[ClientSession] = None

    async def __aenter__(self) -> "SimpleMcpClient":
        self.session = ClientSession(self.transport)
        await self.session.__aenter__()  # ì„¸ì…˜/initialize í•¸ë“œì…°ì´í¬
        return self

    async def __aexit__(self, exc_type, exc, tb) -> None:
        if self.session:
            await self.session.__aexit__(exc_type, exc, tb)

    # ---- ê¸°ëŠ¥: tools/list ----
    async def list_tools(self) -> List[McpTool]:
        assert self.session is not None, "MCP ì„¸ì…˜ì´ ì—´ë ¤ìˆì§€ ì•ŠìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤."
        resp = await self.session.list_tools()
        tools: List[McpTool] = []
        for t in resp.tools:
            tools.append(
                McpTool(
                    name=t.name,
                    description=getattr(t, "description", None),
                    input_schema=getattr(t, "inputSchema", {}) or {},
                )
            )
        return tools

    # ---- ê¸°ëŠ¥: tools/call ----
    async def call_tool(self, name: str, args: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """
        MCP tools/call ì‹¤í–‰ í›„ ê²°ê³¼ë¥¼ í†µì¼ëœ dictë¡œ ë°˜í™˜í•©ë‹ˆë‹¤.
        SDKë§ˆë‹¤ resp.content í˜•íƒœê°€ ë‹¤ë¥¼ ìˆ˜ ìˆìœ¼ë‹ˆ ì—¬ê¸°ì„œ ì •ê·œí™”í•˜ì„¸ìš”.
        """
        assert self.session is not None, "MCP ì„¸ì…˜ì´ ì—´ë ¤ìˆì§€ ì•ŠìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤."
        resp = await self.session.call_tool(name=name, arguments=args)

        # content ì •ê·œí™” ì˜ˆì‹œ:
        # resp.contentê°€ [{"type":"text","text":"..."}, {"type":"json","json":{...}}] í˜•íƒœë¼ê³  ê°€ì •
        out: Dict[str, Any] = {"text": None, "json": None, "raw": None}
        try:
            if hasattr(resp, "content") and isinstance(resp.content, list):
                texts = []
                json_obj = None
                for c in resp.content:
                    if getattr(c, "type", None) == "text":
                        texts.append(getattr(c, "text", ""))
                    elif getattr(c, "type", None) == "json":
                        json_obj = getattr(c, "json", None)
                out["text"] = "\n".join([t for t in texts if t])
                out["json"] = json_obj
                out["raw"] = [c.__dict__ for c in resp.content]  # ë””ë²„ê¹…ìš©
            else:
                # í˜¹ì‹œ ë‹¤ë¥¸ í˜•íƒœë©´ í†µìœ¼ë¡œ ê°ì‹¸ì„œ ë°˜í™˜
                out["raw"] = getattr(resp, "__dict__", resp)
        except Exception:
            out["raw"] = getattr(resp, "__dict__", resp)

        return out

def mcp_tools_to_openai_tools(mcp_tools: List[McpTool]) -> List[Dict[str, Any]]:
    """
    OpenAI Chat Completions `tools` íŒŒë¼ë¯¸í„° ê·œê²©:
    [
      {
        "type": "function",
        "function": {
          "name": str,
          "description": str,
          "parameters": {JSON Schema}
        }
      }
    ]
    """
    out: List[Dict[str, Any]] = []
    for t in mcp_tools:
        name = t.name[:64]  # OpenAI ì œì•½: ìµœëŒ€ 64ì ê¶Œì¥
        params = t.input_schema or {"type": "object", "properties": {}}
        if "type" not in params:
            # ì¼ë¶€ ì„œë²„ê°€ "object" ìƒëµ ì‹œ ëŒ€ë¹„
            params = {"type": "object", **params}
        out.append(
            {
                "type": "function",
                "function": {
                    "name": name,
                    "description": t.description or "",
                    "parameters": params,
                },
            }
        )
    return out

# ë¸Œë¦¬ì§€: ëª¨ë¸ <-> MCP í˜¸ì¶œ ë£¨í”„
# ------------------------------------------------------------
class McpBridge:
    def __init__(
        self,
        oai: AsyncOpenAI,
        model: str,
        mcp: SimpleMcpClient,
        *,
        max_hops: int = 8,
        per_tool_timeout_s: float = 30.0,
        per_tool_retries: int = 1,
        parallel: bool = True,
        system_prompt: Optional[str] = None,
    ) -> None:
        self.oai = oai
        self.model = model
        self.mcp = mcp
        self.max_hops = max_hops
        self.per_tool_timeout_s = per_tool_timeout_s
        self.per_tool_retries = per_tool_retries
        self.parallel = parallel
        self.system_prompt = system_prompt or (
            "You are a careful assistant. "
            "Call tools only when needed, keep arguments minimal and valid JSON."
        )
        self._cached_openai_tools: Optional[List[Dict[str, Any]]] = None

    async def _ensure_tools(self) -> List[Dict[str, Any]]:
        if self._cached_openai_tools is None:
            mcp_tools = await self.mcp.list_tools()
            self._cached_openai_tools = mcp_tools_to_openai_tools(mcp_tools)
        return self._cached_openai_tools

    async def _call_one_tool_with_retry(
        self, call: Dict[str, Any]
    ) -> Tuple[str, Dict[str, Any]]:
        """
        ë‹¨ì¼ tool_call ì‹¤í–‰ + ì¬ì‹œë„/íƒ€ì„ì•„ì›ƒ.
        return: (tool_call_id, tool_result_message)
        """
        tool_call_id = call["id"]
        func = call["function"]
        name = func["name"]
        args_str = func.get("arguments") or "{}"

        # argumentsê°€ JSON íŒŒì‹± ë¶ˆê°€ì¼ ë•Œ ê´€ëŒ€í•œ íŒŒì„œ
        try:
            args = json.loads(args_str) if isinstance(args_str, str) else args_str
        except Exception:
            # ëª¨ë¸ì´ ë¬¸ìì—´ì„ ê·¸ëŒ€ë¡œ ë„˜ê¸¸ ìˆ˜ ìˆìœ¼ë‹ˆ ê°ì‹¼ë‹¤
            args = {"_": args_str}

        last_err: Optional[Exception] = None
        for attempt in range(self.per_tool_retries + 1):
            try:
                # MCP tools/callì— íƒ€ì„ì•„ì›ƒ ì ìš©
                out = await asyncio.wait_for(
                    self.mcp.call_tool(name, args),
                    timeout=self.per_tool_timeout_s,
                )
                # OpenAI chat.completionsì— ë„£ì„ tool ë©”ì‹œì§€ ê·œê²©
                tool_msg = {
                    "role": "tool",
                    "tool_call_id": tool_call_id,
                    # ëª¨ë¸ì´ ì†Œë¹„í•˜ê¸° ì‰½ê²Œ ë¬¸ìì—´ + json ëª¨ë‘ ì „ë‹¬
                    "content": json.dumps(out, ensure_ascii=False),
                }
                return tool_call_id, tool_msg
            except Exception as e:
                last_err = e
                if attempt < self.per_tool_retries:
                    await asyncio.sleep(min(2 ** attempt, 2.0))  # ê°„ë‹¨ ë°±ì˜¤í”„
                    continue
                # ì¬ì‹œë„ ì‹¤íŒ¨ ì‹œ ì—ëŸ¬ ë‚´ìš©ì„ tool ê²°ê³¼ë¡œ ì „ë‹¬(ëª¨ë¸ì´ í•¸ë“¤ë§í•˜ê²Œ)
                err_payload = {
                    "error": str(e),
                    "type": e.__class__.__name__,
                }
                tool_msg = {
                    "role": "tool",
                    "tool_call_id": tool_call_id,
                    "content": json.dumps(err_payload, ensure_ascii=False),
                }
                return tool_call_id, tool_msg

from __future__ import annotations

# === ì„¤ì • ===
SAFE_ROOT = Path(os.environ.get("SAFE_ROOT", ".")).resolve()  # ì´ ë””ë ‰í† ë¦¬ ì•ˆì—ì„œë§Œ ì‘ë™
MAX_BYTES_READ = int(os.environ.get("MAX_BYTES_READ", "65536"))  # 64KB
MAX_LIST_ENTRIES = int(os.environ.get("MAX_LIST_ENTRIES", "200"))
MAX_FILES_SCAN = int(os.environ.get("MAX_FILES_SCAN", "400"))
MODEL = os.environ.get("OSS_MODEL", "gpt-oss-20b")

# === ìœ í‹¸: ê²½ë¡œ ì•ˆì „ì„± ë³´ì¥ ===
def _safe_join(rel: str) -> Path:
    """SAFE_ROOT ê¸°ì¤€ ìƒëŒ€ê²½ë¡œë¥¼ ì ˆëŒ€ê²½ë¡œë¡œ ë³€í™˜í•˜ê³ , ë£¨íŠ¸ ë°– ì ‘ê·¼ì„ ì°¨ë‹¨."""
    p = (SAFE_ROOT / rel).resolve()
    try:
        p.relative_to(SAFE_ROOT)
    except ValueError:
        raise PermissionError(f"Path escapes SAFE_ROOT: {p}")
    return p

def _is_text(path: Path) -> bool:
    """ê°„ë‹¨í•œ ë°”ì´ë„ˆë¦¬ íŒë‹¨: ë„ ë°”ì´íŠ¸ ìœ ë¬´ + ê°€ë²¼ìš´ ë””ì½”ë”© ì‹œë„."""
    try:
        with path.open("rb") as f:
            head = f.read(2048)
        if b"\x00" in head:
            return False
        for enc in ("utf-8", "utf-8-sig", "cp949"):
            try:
                head.decode(enc)
                return True
            except Exception:
                continue
        return False
    except Exception:
        return False

# === ë¡œì»¬ íˆ´ êµ¬í˜„ ===
async def tool_list_dir(path: str = ".", glob: str = "*", include_hidden: bool = False) -> Dict[str, Any]:
    base = _safe_join(path)
    if not base.exists():
        return {"error": f"not found: {path}"}
    if base.is_file():
        base = base.parent
    entries = []
    count = 0
    for p in base.glob(glob):
        # ìˆ¨ê¹€ íŒŒì¼ ì œì™¸ ì˜µì…˜
        name = p.name
        if not include_hidden and name.startswith("."):
            continue
        # SAFE_ROOT ë°– symlinkëŠ” ì°¨ë‹¨
        try:
            resolved = p.resolve()
            resolved.relative_to(SAFE_ROOT)
        except Exception:
            continue
        info = {
            "name": name,
            "path": str(p.relative_to(SAFE_ROOT)),
            "type": "dir" if p.is_dir() else "file",
            "size": (p.stat().st_size if p.is_file() else None),
        }
        entries.append(info)
        count += 1
        if count >= MAX_LIST_ENTRIES:
            break
    return {"root": str(SAFE_ROOT), "dir": str(base.relative_to(SAFE_ROOT)), "count": len(entries), "entries": entries}

async def tool_read_text(path: str, max_bytes: Optional[int] = None) -> Dict[str, Any]:
    maxb = max_bytes or MAX_BYTES_READ
    p = _safe_join(path)
    if not p.exists() or not p.is_file():
        return {"error": f"file not found: {path}"}
    if not _is_text(p):
        return {"error": "binary or non-text file (blocked)"}
    size = p.stat().st_size
    content = ""
    enc_used = None
    # ì¸ì½”ë”© í´ë°±
    for enc in ("utf-8", "utf-8-sig", "cp949"):
        try:
            with p.open("r", encoding=enc, errors="replace") as f:
                content = f.read(maxb + 1)
                enc_used = enc
            break
        except Exception:
            continue
    truncated = len(content) > maxb
    if truncated:
        content = content[:maxb]
    return {
        "path": str(p.relative_to(SAFE_ROOT)),
        "encoding": enc_used,
        "size": size,
        "truncated": truncated,
        "text": content,
    }

async def tool_find_in_files(root: str = ".", pattern: str = "", regex: bool = False,
                             glob: str = "**/*", case_sensitive: bool = False,
                             max_files: Optional[int] = None, max_hits_per_file: int = 5) -> Dict[str, Any]:
    base = _safe_join(root)
    if not base.exists() or not base.is_dir():
        return {"error": f"dir not found: {root}"}
    flags = 0 if case_sensitive else re.IGNORECASE
    rx = re.compile(pattern if regex else re.escape(pattern), flags)
    results = []
    files_scanned = 0
    hit_files = 0
    limit = max_files or MAX_FILES_SCAN

    for p in base.glob(glob):
        if files_scanned >= limit:
            break
        try:
            resolved = p.resolve()
            resolved.relative_to(SAFE_ROOT)
        except Exception:
            continue
        if not p.is_file():
            continue
        if not _is_text(p):
            continue
        files_scanned += 1

        # í¬ê¸° ì œí•œ ë‚´ì—ì„œë§Œ ìŠ¤ìº”
        try:
            with p.open("r", encoding="utf-8", errors="replace") as f:
                text = f.read(MAX_BYTES_READ)
        except Exception:
            continue

        hits = []
        for i, line in enumerate(text.splitlines(), start=1):
            if rx.search(line):
                hits.append({"line": i, "preview": line[:300]})
                if len(hits) >= max_hits_per_file:
                    break
        if hits:
            results.append({"path": str(p.relative_to(SAFE_ROOT)), "hits": hits})
            hit_files += 1

    return {
        "root": str(base.relative_to(SAFE_ROOT)),
        "files_scanned": files_scanned,
        "hit_files": hit_files,
        "pattern": pattern,
        "results": results,
        "truncated_note": f"Scanned up to {MAX_BYTES_READ} bytes per file, {limit} files max.",
    }

async def call_local_tool(name: str, args: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
    if name == "list_dir":
        return await tool_list_dir(**args)
    if name == "read_text":
        return await tool_read_text(**args)
    if name == "find_in_files":
        return await tool_find_in_files(**args)
    return {"error": f"unknown tool: {name}"}

def _assistant_msg_dict(msg) -> Dict[str, Any]:
    """OpenAI SDK ê°ì²´ë¥¼ Chat API ì¬í˜¸ì¶œìš© dictë¡œ ë³€í™˜."""
    tool_calls = []
    if msg.tool_calls:
        for c in msg.tool_calls:
            tool_calls.append({
                "id": c.id,
                "type": c.type,
                "function": {
                    "name": c.function.name,
                    "arguments": c.function.arguments,
                },
            })
    return {"role": "assistant", "content": msg.content, "tool_calls": tool_calls or None}

async def run_query(user_input: str) -> str:
    client = AsyncOpenAI(
        base_url=os.environ.get("OPENAI_BASE_URL", "http://localhost:8000/v1"),
        api_key=os.environ.get("OPENAI_API_KEY", "dummy"),
        timeout=60.0,
    )

    system_prompt = (
        "You can inspect files inside SAFE_ROOT only. "
        f"SAFE_ROOT is '{SAFE_ROOT}'. "
        "Call tools only when needed. Prefer concise outputs."
    )
    messages: List[Dict[str, Any]] = [
        {"role": "system", "content": system_prompt},
        {"role": "user", "content": user_input},
    ]

    MAX_HOPS = int(os.environ.get("MAX_HOPS", "8"))
    final_text = ""

    for _ in range(MAX_HOPS):
        resp = await client.chat.completions.create(
            model=MODEL,
            messages=messages,
            tools=OPENAI_TOOLS,
            tool_choice="auto",
            temperature=0.2,
        )
        msg = resp.choices[0].message
        calls = msg.tool_calls or []

        if not calls:  # ì¢…ë£Œ
            final_text = msg.content or ""
            break

        # ë™í„´ ë³‘ë ¬ ì‹¤í–‰
        async def _run_one(c):
            name = c.function.name
            try:
                args = json.loads(c.function.arguments or "{}")
            except Exception:
                args = {"_": c.function.arguments}
            out = await asyncio.wait_for(call_local_tool(name, args), timeout=20.0)
            return {
                "role": "tool",
                "tool_call_id": c.id,
                "content": json.dumps(out, ensure_ascii=False)
            }

        tool_msgs = await asyncio.gather(*[_run_one(c) for c in calls])

        # ì‘ë‹µ(assistant) + ê° tool ê²°ê³¼ë¥¼ ëˆ„ì 
        messages.append(_assistant_msg_dict(msg))
        messages.extend(tool_msgs)

    return final_text

from __future__ import annotations
import asyncio, inspect, json, os
from dataclasses import dataclass

@dataclass
class _ToolEntry:
    func: Callable
    name: str
    desc: str
    schema: Dict[str, Any]

_REGISTRY: Dict[str, _ToolEntry] = {}

def inline_tool(_fn=None, *, name: Optional[str]=None, description: Optional[str]=None):
    """í•¨ìˆ˜ì— ë‹¬ì•„ì£¼ë©´ ìë™ìœ¼ë¡œ OpenAI tools ìŠ¤í‚¤ë§ˆê°€ ë§Œë“¤ì–´ì ¸ ë“±ë¡ë©ë‹ˆë‹¤."""
    def decorator(fn: Callable):
        tname = (name or fn.__name__)[:64]
        schema = _build_openai_tool_schema(fn, tname, description or (fn.__doc__ or ""))
        _REGISTRY[tname] = _ToolEntry(fn=fn, name=tname, desc=schema["function"]["description"], schema=schema)
        return fn
    return decorator if _fn is None else decorator(_fn)

def _pytype_to_schema(tp) -> Dict[str, Any]:
    # ì•„ì£¼ ê°€ë²¼ìš´ ë§¤í•‘: í•„ìš” ì‹œ í™•ì¥í•˜ì„¸ìš”.
    origin = get_origin(tp)
    args = get_args(tp)
    if tp in (str, None) or origin is None and tp is inspect._empty:
        return {"type": "string"}
    if tp in (int,):
        return {"type": "integer"}
    if tp in (float,):
        return {"type": "number"}
    if tp in (bool,):
        return {"type": "boolean"}
    if origin in (list, List):
        item_schema = _pytype_to_schema(args[0] if args else str)
        return {"type": "array", "items": item_schema}
    if origin in (dict, Dict):
        return {"type": "object"}
    # Optional[T] ì²˜ë¦¬
    if origin is Optional:
        return _pytype_to_schema(args[0])
    # ê·¸ ì™¸ì—” ë¬¸ìì—´ë¡œ ì²˜ë¦¬(ë³´ìˆ˜ì )
    return {"type": "string"}

def _build_openai_tool_schema(fn: Callable, name: str, desc: str) -> Dict[str, Any]:
    sig = inspect.signature(fn)
    properties: Dict[str, Any] = {}
    required: List[str] = []
    for pname, param in sig.parameters.items():
        ann = param.annotation
        sch = _pytype_to_schema(ann)
        if param.default is not inspect._empty:
            sch["default"] = param.default
        else:
            required.append(pname)
        properties[pname] = sch
    return {
        "type": "function",
        "function": {
            "name": name,
            "description": desc,
            "parameters": {"type": "object", "properties": properties, "required": required},
        },
    }

def compiled_tools() -> List[Dict[str, Any]]:
    return [e.schema for e in _REGISTRY.values()]

# 1) ìƒ˜í”Œ ì¸ë¼ì¸ íˆ´(íŒŒì¼ ê´€ë ¨, ì˜µì…˜)

SAFE_ROOT = Path(os.environ.get("SAFE_ROOT", ".")).resolve()

def _safe(rel: str) -> Path:
    p = (SAFE_ROOT / rel).resolve()
    p.relative_to(SAFE_ROOT)  # ë°–ìœ¼ë¡œ ë‚˜ê°€ë©´ ì˜ˆì™¸
    return p

@inline_tool
def list_dir(path: str = ".") -> List[Dict[str, Any]]:
    """List directory entries under SAFE_ROOT."""
    base = _safe(path)
    if not base.exists():
        return []
    out = []
    for ch in base.iterdir():
        out.append({
            "name": ch.name,
            "type": "dir" if ch.is_dir() else "file",
            "size": ch.stat().st_size if ch.is_file() else None

    return out

@inline_tool
def read_text(path: str, max_bytes: int = 65536) -> Dict[str, Any]:
    """Read a text file with size/encoding guards."""
    fp = _safe(path)
    text = fp.read_text(encoding="utf-8", errors="replace")[:max_bytes]
    return {"path": str(fp.relative_to(SAFE_ROOT)), "text": text}

@inline_tool
async def slow_count_chars(path: str) -> int:

def _assistant_msg_dict(msg) -> Dict[str, Any]:
    tc = []
    if msg.tool_calls:
        for c in msg.tool_calls:
            tc.append({
                "id": c.id,
                "type": c.type,
                "function": {"name": c.function.name, "arguments": c.function.arguments},
            })
    return {"role": "assistant", "content": msg.content, "tool_calls": tc or None}

async def _call_inline_tool(tool_name: str, args_json: str, timeout_s: float = 20.0) -> Dict[str, Any]:
    if tool_name not in _REGISTRY:
        return {"error": f"unknown tool: {tool_name}"}
    entry = _REGISTRY[tool_name]
    try:
        args = json.loads(args_json or "{}")
    except Exception:
        args = {"_": args_json}

    async def _runner():
        res = entry.func(**args)
        if inspect.iscoroutine(res):
            res = await res
        return res

    try:
        result = await asyncio.wait_for(_runner(), timeout=timeout_s)
        return {"ok": True, "result": result}
    except Exception as e:
        return {"ok": False, "error": str(e), "type": e.__class__.__name__}

async def chat_with_inline_tools(user_input: str) -> str:
    client = AsyncOpenAI(
        base_url=os.environ.get("OPENAI_BASE_URL", "http://localhost:8000/v1"),
        api_key=os.environ.get("OPENAI_API_KEY", "dummy"),
        timeout=60.0,
    )
    model = os.environ.get("OSS_MODEL", "gpt-oss-20b")
    tools = compiled_tools()

    messages: List[Dict[str, Any]] = [
        {"role": "system", "content": f"You can use tools. SAFE_ROOT is '{SAFE_ROOT}'."},
        {"role": "user", "content": user_input},
    ]
    MAX_HOPS = int(os.environ.get("MAX_HOPS", "8"))
    final = ""

    for _ in range(MAX_HOPS):
        resp = await client.chat.completions.create(
            model=model,
            messages=messages,
            tools=tools,
            tool_choice="auto",
            temperature=0.2,
        )
        msg = resp.choices[0].message
        calls = msg.tool_calls or []
        if not calls:
            final = msg.content or ""
            break

        # ë™í„´ ë³‘ë ¬ ì‹¤í–‰
        async def _one(c):
            out = await _call_inline_tool(c.function.name, c.function.arguments)
            return {"role": "tool", "tool_call_id": c.id, "content": json.dumps(out, ensure_ascii=False)}

        tool_msgs = await asyncio.gather(*[_one(c) for c in calls])

        messages.append(_assistant_msg_dict(msg))
        messages.extend(tool_msgs)

    return final

@mcp.tool
def list_dir(path: str = ".") -> list[dict]:
    """List directory entries."""
    import os, pathlib
    p = pathlib.Path(path).resolve()
    entries = []
    for name in os.listdir(p):
        full = p / name
        entries.append({
            "name": name,
            "type": "dir" if full.is_dir() else "file",
            "size": full.stat().st_size if full.is_file() else None
        })
    return entries

@mcp.tool
def read_text(path: str, max_bytes: int = 65536) -> dict:
    """Read a UTF-8 text file (size-limited)."""
    from pathlib import Path
    fp = Path(path).resolve()
    text = fp.read_text(encoding="utf-8", errors="replace")[:max_bytes]
    return {"path": str(fp), "text": text}

def _schema_of(tool_obj) -> Dict[str, Any]:
    # FastMCPê°€ ë‚´ì£¼ëŠ” ì†ì„± ì´ë¦„ì´ êµ¬í˜„ë³„ë¡œ ë‹¤ë¥¼ ìˆ˜ ìˆì–´ ëŒ€ë¹„

def _to_openai_tools(mcp_tools) -> List[Dict[str, Any]]:
    out = []

            "function": {

def _assistant_msg_dict(msg) -> Dict[str, Any]:
    tool_calls = []
    if msg.tool_calls:

            tool_calls.append({

                "type": c.type,
                "function": {"name": c.function.name, "arguments": c.function.arguments}

    return {"role": "assistant", "content": msg.content, "tool_calls": tool_calls or None}

async def _call_tool(client: Client, tool_name: str, args_json: str, timeout_s: float = 20.0) -> Dict[str, Any]:
    try:
        args = json.loads(args_json or "{}")
    except Exception:

    async def _runner():

# tools_adders.py
from __future__ import annotations
from pathlib import Path
from typing import Any, Dict
from fastmcp import FastMCP

def add_read_text_tool(mcp: FastMCP, *, root: str | Path = ".",
                       name: str = "read_text", default_max_bytes: int = 65536) -> FastMCP:
    """read_text(path, max_bytes) íˆ´ì„ mcpì— ë“±ë¡í•˜ê³  mcpë¥¼ ë°˜í™˜."""
    ROOT = Path(root).resolve()

    def _safe(rel: str) -> Path:
        p = (ROOT / rel).resolve()
        p.relative_to(ROOT)  # ë°–ìœ¼ë¡œ ë‚˜ê°€ë©´ ì˜ˆì™¸
        return p

    def read_text(path: str, max_bytes: int = default_max_bytes) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """Read a UTF-8 text file under ROOT with size limit."""
        fp = _safe(path)
        txt = fp.read_text(encoding="utf-8", errors="replace")[:max_bytes]
        return {"path": str(fp.relative_to(ROOT)), "text": txt}

    # í•¨ìˆ˜ ì´ë¦„ì„ ë°”ê¾¸ê³  ì‹¶ìœ¼ë©´ wrapperì˜ __name__ì„ ë°”ê¿”ë„ ë˜ê³ â€¦
    read_text.__name__ = name
    mcp.tool(read_text)          # â† ì—¬ê¸°ì„œ ë“±ë¡!
    return mcp

def add_list_dir_tool(mcp: FastMCP, *, root: str | Path = ".",
                      name: str = "list_dir") -> FastMCP:
    """list_dir(path='.') íˆ´ ë“±ë¡."""
    ROOT = Path(root).resolve()

    def _safe(rel: str) -> Path:
        p = (ROOT / rel).resolve()
        p.relative_to(ROOT)
        return p

    def list_dir(path: str = ".") -> list[dict]:
        """List directory entries under ROOT."""
        base = _safe(path)
        return [{
            "name": p.name,
            "type": "dir" if p.is_dir() else "file",
            "size": p.stat().st_size if p.is_file() else None
        } for p in base.iterdir()]

    list_dir.__name__ = name
    mcp.tool(list_dir)
    return mcp

class Files:
